org.sonatype.goodies.dropwizard.ratelimit

Class LeakyBucket

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.sonatype.goodies.dropwizard.ratelimit.LeakyBucket

  • public class LeakyBucket
extends Object
    Leaky bucket algorithm. Bucket starts out empty with a capacity, and a drain count-per-period and period. Drops (units of work or requests or whatever) are added to the bucket. Before drops are added, the bucket is potentially drained based on configured rate. If the bucket is ever filled with more drops than capacity then the bucket is considered overflown. Overflown drops are all discarded, even if a portion of drops could fit before overflowing with fill(long).
    Since:
    1.2.0

        public long drain()

        Returns:

      • fill

        public boolean fill(long count)
        Attempt to fill bucket. Before filling bucket is checked for potential drainage.
        Parameters:
        count - Number of drops to add to bucket.
        Returns:
        true if adding count drops to bucket would overflow. All (including non-overflowing) drops are discarded.
